abstract: The Federal Communications Commission moved cautiously toward creating an open wireless broadband network as it weighed the interests of cellphone carriers and other contenders.
snippet: The Federal Communications Commission moved cautiously toward creating an open wireless broadband network as it weighed the interests of cellphone carriers and other contenders.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, July 31 — The Federal Communications Commission moved cautiously Tuesday toward creating a more open national wireless broadband network, handing a partial victory to Google, which was pushing for more competition in cellphone services.

headline.main: F.C.C. Hands Google a Partial Victory
headline.print_headline: As Spectrum Auction Nears, Google Wins Partial Victory in F.C.C. Ruling on Open Networks

byline.original: By John Markoff and Matt Richtel
